<MembersIndexItem
  type="namespace"
  name={<><a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm">llvm</a></>}>
This is an optimization pass for GlobalISel generic memory operations. <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#details">More...</a>

</MembersIndex>

## Classes Index

<MembersIndex>

<MembersIndexItem
  type="class"
  name={<><a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/sectionmemorymanager">SectionMemoryManager</a></>}>
This is a simple memory manager which implements the methods called by the <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/runtimedyld">RuntimeDyld</a> class to allocate memory for section-based loading of objects, usually those generated by the <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/mcjit">MCJIT</a> execution engine. <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/sectionmemorymanager/#details">More...</a>
</MembersIndexItem>

<MembersIndexItem
  type="class"
  name={<><a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/sectionmemorymanager/memorymapper">MemoryMapper</a></>}>
Implementations of this interface are used by <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/sectionmemorymanager">SectionMemoryManager</a> to request pages from the operating system. <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/sectionmemorymanager/memorymapper/#details">More...</a>
</MembersIndexItem>

<MembersIndexItem
  type="struct"
  name={<><a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/sectionmemorymanager/freememblock">FreeMemBlock</a></>}>
</MembersIndexItem>

<MembersIndexItem
  type="struct"
  name={<><a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/sectionmemorymanager/memorygroup">MemoryGroup</a></>}>
</MembersIndexItem>

</MembersIndex>

<Link id="l00026" /><CodeLine lineNumber="26"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// This is a simple memory manager which implements the methods called by</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00027" /><CodeLine lineNumber="27"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// the RuntimeDyld class to allocate memory for section-based loading of</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00028" /><CodeLine lineNumber="28"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// objects, usually those generated by the MCJIT execution engine.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00029" /><CodeLine lineNumber="29"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00030" /><CodeLine lineNumber="30"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// This memory manager allocates all section memory as read-write.  The</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00031" /><CodeLine lineNumber="31"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// RuntimeDyld will copy JITed section memory into these allocated blocks</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00032" /><CodeLine lineNumber="32"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// and perform any necessary linking and relocations.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00033" /><CodeLine lineNumber="33"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00034" /><CodeLine lineNumber="34"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// Any client using this memory manager MUST ensure that section-specific</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00035" /><CodeLine lineNumber="35"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// page permissions have been applied before attempting to execute functions</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00036" /><CodeLine lineNumber="36"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// in the JITed object.  Permissions can be applied either by calling</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00037" /><CodeLine lineNumber="37"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// MCJIT::finalizeObject or by calling SectionMemoryManager::finalizeMemory</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00038" /><CodeLine lineNumber="38"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// directly.  Clients of MCJIT should call MCJIT::finalizeObject.</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00053" /><CodeLine lineNumber="53"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">    /// This method attempts to allocate \\p NumBytes bytes of virtual memory for</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00054" /><CodeLine lineNumber="54"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">    /// \\p Purpose.  \\p NearBlock may point to an existing allocation, in which</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00055" /><CodeLine lineNumber="55"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">    /// case an attempt is made to allocate more memory near the existing block.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00056" /><CodeLine lineNumber="56"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">    /// The actual allocated address is not guaranteed to be near the requested</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00057" /><CodeLine lineNumber="57"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">    /// address.  \\p Flags is used to set the initial protection flags for the</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00058" /><CodeLine lineNumber="58"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">    /// block of the memory.  \\p EC &#91;out&#93; returns an object describing any error</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00059" /><CodeLine lineNumber="59"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">    /// that occurs.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00060" /><CodeLine lineNumber="60"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">    ///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00061" /><CodeLine lineNumber="61"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">    /// This method may allocate more than the number of bytes requested.  The</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00062" /><CodeLine lineNumber="62"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">    /// actual number of bytes allocated is indicated in the returned</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00063" /><CodeLine lineNumber="63"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">    /// MemoryBlock.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00064" /><CodeLine lineNumber="64"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">    ///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00065" /><CodeLine lineNumber="65"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">    /// The start of the allocated block must be aligned with the system</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00066" /><CodeLine lineNumber="66"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">    /// allocation granularity (64K on Windows, page size on Linux).  If the</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00067" /><CodeLine lineNumber="67"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">    /// address following \\p NearBlock is not so aligned, it will be rounded up</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00068" /><CodeLine lineNumber="68"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">    /// to the next allocation granularity boundary.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00069" /><CodeLine lineNumber="69"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">    ///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00070" /><CodeLine lineNumber="70"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">    /// \\r a non-null MemoryBlock if the function was successful, otherwise a</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00071" /><CodeLine lineNumber="71"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">    /// null MemoryBlock with \\p EC describing the error.</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00083" /><CodeLine lineNumber="83"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">    /// If \\p Flags is MF&#95;WRITE, the actual behavior varies with the operating</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00111" /><CodeLine lineNumber="111"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00112" /><CodeLine lineNumber="112"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// Allocates a memory block of (at least) the given size suitable for</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00113" /><CodeLine lineNumber="113"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// executable code.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00114" /><CodeLine lineNumber="114"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  ///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00115" /><CodeLine lineNumber="115"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// The value of \\p Alignment must be a power of two.  If \\p Alignment is zero</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00116" /><CodeLine lineNumber="116"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// a default alignment of 16 will be used.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00117" /><CodeLine lineNumber="117"><span class="doxyHighlight">  uint8&#95;t &#42;<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/sectionmemorymanager/#acfcf22eac937cf698005e9cc378cad73">allocateCodeSection</a>(uintptr&#95;t <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/analysis/inlineorder-cpp/#a7ee6f0cb51c3b9056199e9a0001fe8c3a6f6cb72d544962fa333e2e34ce64f719">Size</a>, </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">unsigned</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> Alignment,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00118" /><CodeLine lineNumber="118"><span class="doxyHighlight">                               </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">unsigned</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> SectionID,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00119" /><CodeLine lineNumber="119"><span class="doxyHighlight">                               <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/stringref">StringRef</a> <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/sectionname">SectionName</a>) </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">override</span><span class="doxyHighlight">;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00120" /><CodeLine lineNumber="120"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00121" /><CodeLine lineNumber="121"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// Allocates a memory block of (at least) the given size suitable for</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00122" /><CodeLine lineNumber="122"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// executable code.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00123" /><CodeLine lineNumber="123"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  ///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00124" /><CodeLine lineNumber="124"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// The value of \\p Alignment must be a power of two.  If \\p Alignment is zero</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00125" /><CodeLine lineNumber="125"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// a default alignment of 16 will be used.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00126" /><CodeLine lineNumber="126"><span class="doxyHighlight">  uint8&#95;t &#42;<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/sectionmemorymanager/#ac4eeaddc4bbbe555cb2abc159b96492c">allocateDataSection</a>(uintptr&#95;t <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/analysis/inlineorder-cpp/#a7ee6f0cb51c3b9056199e9a0001fe8c3a6f6cb72d544962fa333e2e34ce64f719">Size</a>, </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">unsigned</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> Alignment,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00127" /><CodeLine lineNumber="127"><span class="doxyHighlight">                               </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">unsigned</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> SectionID, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/stringref">StringRef</a> <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/sectionname">SectionName</a>,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00128" /><CodeLine lineNumber="128"><span class="doxyHighlight">                               </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">bool</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> isReadOnly) </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">override</span><span class="doxyHighlight">;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00129" /><CodeLine lineNumber="129"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00130" /><CodeLine lineNumber="130"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// Update section-specific memory permissions and other attributes.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00131" /><CodeLine lineNumber="131"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  ///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00132" /><CodeLine lineNumber="132"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// This method is called when object loading is complete and section page</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00133" /><CodeLine lineNumber="133"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// permissions can be applied.  It is up to the memory manager implementation</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00134" /><CodeLine lineNumber="134"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// to decide whether or not to act on this method.  The memory manager will</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00135" /><CodeLine lineNumber="135"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// typically allocate all sections as read-write and then apply specific</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00136" /><CodeLine lineNumber="136"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// permissions when this method is called.  Code sections cannot be executed</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00137" /><CodeLine lineNumber="137"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// until this function has been called.  In addition, any cache coherency</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00138" /><CodeLine lineNumber="138"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// operations needed to reliably use the memory are also performed.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00139" /><CodeLine lineNumber="139"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  ///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00140" /><CodeLine lineNumber="140"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// \\returns true if an error occurred, false otherwise.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00141" /><CodeLine lineNumber="141"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">bool</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/sectionmemorymanager/#af06d61d7c637095c5b7270b34224c5dd">finalizeMemory</a>(std::string &#42;ErrMsg = </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">nullptr</span><span class="doxyHighlight">) </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">override</span><span class="doxyHighlight">;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00142" /><CodeLine lineNumber="142"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00143" /><CodeLine lineNumber="143"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// Invalidate instruction cache for code sections.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00144" /><CodeLine lineNumber="144"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  ///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00145" /><CodeLine lineNumber="145"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// Some platforms with separate data cache and instruction cache require</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00146" /><CodeLine lineNumber="146"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// explicit cache flush, otherwise JIT code manipulations (like resolved</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00147" /><CodeLine lineNumber="147"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// relocations) will get to the data cache but not to the instruction cache.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00148" /><CodeLine lineNumber="148"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  ///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00149" /><CodeLine lineNumber="149"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// This method is called from finalizeMemory.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00150" /><CodeLine lineNumber="150"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">virtual</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">void</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/sectionmemorymanager/#a64835973f93c4f018aa377870e15ee97">invalidateInstructionCache</a>();</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00151" /><CodeLine lineNumber="151"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00152" /><CodeLine lineNumber="152"><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">private</span><span class="doxyHighlight">:</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00153" /><CodeLine lineNumber="153"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">struct </span><span class="doxyHighlight">FreeMemBlock &#123;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00154" /><CodeLine lineNumber="154"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// The actual block of free memory</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00155" /><CodeLine lineNumber="155"><span class="doxyHighlight">    <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/sys/memoryblock">sys::MemoryBlock</a> <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#a264176188c0aadccd3ca5b6929b5a2e1ab24ce0cd392a5b0b8dedc66c25213594">Free</a>;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00156" /><CodeLine lineNumber="156"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// If there is a pending allocation from the same reservation right before</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00157" /><CodeLine lineNumber="157"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// this block, store it&#39;s index in PendingMem, to be able to update the</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00158" /><CodeLine lineNumber="158"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// pending region if part of this block is allocated, rather than having to</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00159" /><CodeLine lineNumber="159"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// create a new one</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00160" /><CodeLine lineNumber="160"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">unsigned</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> PendingPrefixIndex;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00161" /><CodeLine lineNumber="161"><span class="doxyHighlight">  &#125;;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00162" /><CodeLine lineNumber="162"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00163" /><CodeLine lineNumber="163"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">struct </span><span class="doxyHighlight">MemoryGroup &#123;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00164" /><CodeLine lineNumber="164"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// PendingMem contains all blocks of memory (subblocks of AllocatedMem)</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00165" /><CodeLine lineNumber="165"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// which have not yet had their permissions applied, but have been given</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00166" /><CodeLine lineNumber="166"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// out to the user. FreeMem contains all block of memory, which have</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00167" /><CodeLine lineNumber="167"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// neither had their permissions applied, nor been given out to the user.</span></CodeLine>
